issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Support generic PartitionSpecs in Metastore partition-functions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
{{ObjectStore.setConf()}} has the following code:
{code:java}
String partitionValidationRegex =
 hiveConf.get(HiveConf.ConfVars.METASTORE_PARTITION_NAME_WHITELIST_PATTERN.name());
{code}
Â Note that it uses name() method which returns enum name (METASTORE_PARTITION_NAME_WHITELIST_PATTERN) rather then .varname

As a result the regex will always be null.

The code was introduced as part of 

HIVE-7223 Support generic PartitionSpecs in Metastore partition-functions

So looks like this was broken since the original code drop. This is fixed in Hive3 - probably when [~alangates] reworked access to configuration (HIVE-17733) so it isn't a bug in Hive-3.

[~stakiar_impala_496e] FYI.
fields.summary: Partition whitelist regex doesn't work (and never did)

ATTACHMENT ID: 12920899 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Attaching the same patch - for some reason it failed to apply the first time.

+1 
I think you are not following fully the patch naming conventions:
{code}
HIVE-<JIRA-NUMBER>[.<patch-num>][-<branch-name>].patch
{code}
I totally agree that HIVE-XXX.01.branch-name.patch would be more logical...but somehow the above is the current format...
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute#HowToContribute-AttachingandSubmittingaPatch

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12930033/HIVE-19337.03.branch-2.patch
